why don’t you just call all the options/interfaces (wilderness, dueling, multi) client-side…?

item.title: Help with new option
item.dc:creator: @Maximum_ZxZ Maximum ZxZ
item.description:
@Maximum_ZxZ wrote:

[quote=“Jordiescape, post:10, topic:296269”][quote author=Jordiescape link=topic=392294.msg2921270#msg2921270 date=1250775396]
Yeah because all you did was add a void…? You need to call that void, also you have unused crap in it.

public void showDuelArenaIcon() { if (absX >= 3343 && absX <= 3384 && absY >= 3265 && absY <= 3286) { outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(2); outStream.writeByteA(0); outStream.writeString("Duel"); outStream.endFrameVarSize(); } }
[b]Then in process() add:

showDuelArenaIcon();

You could do it without using process, but I can’t be assed to find the loading packet.
[/quote]
?!?!?[/quote]

Huh ?

Read full topic

public void showDuelArenaIcon() { if (absX >= 3343 && absX <= 3384 && absY >= 3265 && absY <= 3286) { outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(2); outStream.writeByteA(0); outStream.writeString("Duel"); outStream.endFrameVarSize(); } }

item.title: Help with new option
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

Yeah because all you did was add a void…? You need to call that void, also you have unused crap in it.

public void showDuelArenaIcon() { if (absX >= 3343 && absX <= 3384 && absY >= 3265 && absY <= 3286) { outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(2); outStream.writeByteA(0); outStream.writeString("Duel"); outStream.endFrameVarSize(); } }
Then in process() add:

showDuelArenaIcon();

You could do it without using process, but I can’t be assed to find the loading packet.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with new option
item.dc:creator: @Maximum_ZxZ Maximum ZxZ
item.description:
@Maximum_ZxZ wrote:

public void isInDuelArena(int coordX, int coordY, int Type) { if (absX >= 3343 && absX <= 3384 && absY >= 3265 && absY <= 3286) { outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(2); outStream.writeByteA(0); outStream.writeString("Duel"); outStream.endFrameVarSize(); } }

This is what I added now and it still doesn’t work. I get no error and I don’t see the “Duel” in-game.

Help please.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with new option

item.description:
@_Joshua1 wrote:

Why don’t you add the duel option near the attack option in Client.java and make it so it only shows up if they are in duel arena’s area. Instead of cramming it all into the isin boolean.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with new option
item.dc:creator: @Maximum_ZxZ Maximum ZxZ
item.description:
@Maximum_ZxZ wrote:

[quote=“Seerofdeath, post:3, topic:296269”][quote author=Newty link=topic=392294.msg2920711#msg2920711 date=1250728805]
Place it near:

public boolean isInWilderness

Idk why.
[/quote]
I like you newty, you’re a mod that accualy helps people and doesnt go around and lock topics and provide no help. keep up the good work =][/quote]

This is true, keep up your work, Nexty.

I get 100 errors. I changed my code to:

public boolean isInDuelArena(int coordX, int coordY, int Type) { if ((coordY >= 3260) && (coordY <= 3289) && (coordX <= 3384) && (coordX >= 3345)) { outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(2); outStream.writeByteA(0); outStream.writeString("Duel"); outStream.endFrameVarSize(); return true; } else { outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(2); outStream.writeByteA(0); outStream.writeString("null"); outStream.endFrameVarSize(); return true; } }

Now, I get no errors but it doesn’t show the Duel option in duel arena.

Please help.

Read full topic
